longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid on arrival.
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a Macao (SAR China) Travel Permit.
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days:
 - for holders of Macao (SAR China) passports; 
 - for holders of Hong Kong (SAR China) passports; 
Visa required, except for Holders of a visa issued by
Australia, Canada, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, USA or an
EEA Member State  to nationals of China (People's
Rep.) provided in transit through Korea (Rep.):

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 15 days for nationals
of China (People's Rep) arriving at Busan Gimhae (PUS),
Cheongju (CJJ), Muan (MWX), Seoul Incheon (ICN) or Yangyang
(YNY) and traveling on to Jeju (CJU) as part of a tourist
group organized by authorized Korean or Chinese travel agents.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 30 days for nationals
of China (People's Rep.) traveling as tourist, if arriving at
and departing from Jeju (CJU) and  
Visa required, except for Holders of an APEC Business Travel
Card (ABTC) provided endorsed  Valid for travel
to KOR". 
Additional Information:
- Holders of e-visas are required to hold an Electronic Visa
  Issuance Confirmation, issued by the Ministry of Justice.
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination.
Warning:
- Passport number and nationality must match those stated on
  the APEC Business Travel Card (ABTC).



 Korea (Rep
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is limited and exists mainly in the northern areas of
  Gangwon Do and Gyeonggi-do Provinces and Incheon City
  (towards the Demilitarized Zone or DMZ). Recommended
  prevention: A.
